errors.error_description: The README specifies 'Python 3+' which is too vague and may lead to compatibility issues with older Python 3 versions.
The command for local installation 'pip install -e' is incomplete and will cause a syntax error because it is missing the path specifier.
correction_candidates: run `pip install -e .` (don't forget the dot at the end!).
errors.golden_answer: run `pip install -e .` (don't forget the dot at the end!).
